Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2008 05:03AM JMJ532 wrote: Hi Heather, I had two drains and major incisions in my bottom.  My doctors told me to wait 1 week before showering and then I could.  I wasn't feeling the best so I rented one of those seats that go in the shower.  I would sit on that with the shower water running down on me.  I put my drains onto the seat while I showered.  As well, on my butt incisions I put tegaderm (a clear like bandage to cover stitches). Just remember you have the drains on the seat and lift them when you go to get out of the shower--I forgot a few times and when I stood up my drains dangled--ouch! In the meantime, before showering, I had bought diaper wipes and used them to sponge bathe. Good luck, JMJ

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2008 11:01PM JMJ532 wrote: Hi, I agree with ckslow--bloody discharge is serious no matter how small.  This could be sign of DCis and does not always show up on mammo, ultrasounds, or even MRI.  My surgeon removed the duct the blood was coming from thinking it was an intraductal papilloma (usually non-cancerous about 90 percent of time. Well, I was unlucky 10 percent and it was DCIS. Please advocate for yourself.  Hopefully, it is just a papilloma. Let us know!

Posts.Content: May 13, 2008 09:07PM JMJ532 wrote: Hi, You may decide to go to a surgeon and see if you may need to have a duct removed; my nipple wasn't greenish discharge but rather a bit bloody.  I went in for an intraductal papilloma to be removed (no cancerous signs on MRI, mammogram, or ultrasound)--95% of time this was to be non-cancerous; unfortunately I was in the low 5%.  My surgeon was surprised at finding cancer--luckily it was found early! Do what you think is best for you.......remember that you are your own best advocate! JMJ
